package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;

 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.

	@NotNull

	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward

	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {

			case '.':

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.

public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward

	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':

			case '.':

Response Text:---
The error message indicates that the `EmptyCell` and `TerminationCell` constructors are not being called with the correct arguments. Specifically, `TerminationCell` requires a `Direction` argument, which is missing in the original code. Also, the `EmptyCell` class was not found, so it must be created.

```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}
```
---Response Text

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':

					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;

				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);

				break;

				return null;
		}

		return null;

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

```

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;

					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}

```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}
```
The error "cannot find symbol class EmptyCell" indicates that the class `EmptyCell` is not visible or does not exist in the current context. To fix this, ensure that `EmptyCell` is defined in the same package or imported if it's in a different package. Since no import statements are missing, it's likely that the class simply doesn't exist. I will create a basic `EmptyCell` class to resolve this issue.

```java
package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

import util.Coordinate;

public class EmptyCell extends Cell {

    public EmptyCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
        super(coord);
    }

    @Override
    public char toSingleChar() {
        return '.';
    }
}
```

Now, applying the above fix, here's the complete `Cell` class:

```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':

					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':

				}
				break;
			case '>':

					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;

	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */

Response Text:---
The error "cannot find symbol: class EmptyCell" indicates that the `EmptyCell` class is not visible or accessible in the current context (the `Cell` class). This usually means that the `EmptyCell` class is either not defined in the same package as the `Cell` class and hasn't been imported, or it doesn't exist at all. Since the task description doesn't provide the code for `EmptyCell`, `Wall` and `TerminationCell`, I will create them.

```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}

class Wall extends Cell {
	Wall(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		super(coord);
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		return 'W';
	}
}

class EmptyCell extends Cell {
	EmptyCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		super(coord);
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		return '.';
	}
}

class TerminationCell extends Cell {
	public enum Type {
		SOURCE,
		SINK
	}

	@NotNull
	private final Direction direction;
	@NotNull
	private final Type type;

	TerminationCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction direction, @NotNull Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.direction = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		switch (direction) {
			case UP:
				return '^';
			case DOWN:
				return 'v';
			case LEFT:
				return '<';
			case RIGHT:
				return '>';
			default:
				return '?'; // Should not happen
		}
	}
}
```

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}

class Wall extends Cell {
	Wall(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		super(coord);
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		return 'W';
	}
}

class EmptyCell extends Cell {
	EmptyCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		super(coord);
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		return '.';
	}
}

class TerminationCell extends Cell {
	public enum Type {
		SOURCE,
		SINK
	}

	@NotNull
	private final Direction direction;
	@NotNull
	private final Type type;

	TerminationCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction direction, @NotNull Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.direction = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		switch (direction) {
			case UP:
				return '^';
			case DOWN:
				return 'v';
			case LEFT:
				return '<';
			case RIGHT:
				return '>';
			default:
				return '?'; // Should not happen
		}
	}
}

package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

	@NotNull
	public final Coordinate coord;

	Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		this.coord = coord;
	}

	/**
	 * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
	 *
	 * <p>
	 * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
	 * W: Wall
	 * .: Cell
	 * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
	 * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
	 * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
	 * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
	 * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @param c Character to parse. For example, 'W' refers to a wall.
	 * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
	 * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
	 *                        can be null.
	 * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
	 */
	public static Cell fromChar(char c, Coordinate coord, TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
		switch (c) {
			case 'W':
				return new Wall(coord);
			case '.':
				return new EmptyCell(coord);
			case '^':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case 'v':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '<':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			case '>':
				if (terminationType != null) {
					return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
				}
				break;
			default:
				return null;
		}

		return null;
	}
}

	Wall(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		super(coord);
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		return 'W';
	}
}

	EmptyCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
		super(coord);
	}

	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		return '.';
	}
}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE,
		SINK
	}

	@NotNull
	private final Direction direction;
	@NotNull
	private final Type type;

	TerminationCell(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction direction, @NotNull Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.direction = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	public char toSingleChar() {
		switch (direction) {
			case UP:
				return '^';
			case DOWN:
				return 'v';
			case LEFT:
				return '<';
			case RIGHT:
				return '>';
			default:
				return '?'; // Should not happen
		}
	}

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.

	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		// TODO
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		// TODO
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		// TODO
		return '\0';
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

```
```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

    @NotNull
    public final Coordinate coord;

    Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
        this.coord = coord;
    }

    /**
     * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
     *
     * <p>
     * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
     * W: Wall
     * .: Cell
     * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
     * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
     * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
     * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
     * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
     * </p>
     *
     * @param c Character to parse.
     * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
     * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
     *                        can be null.
     * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
     */
    public static @Nullable Cell fromChar(char c, @NotNull Coordinate coord, @Nullable TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
        switch (c) {
            case 'W':
                return new Wall(coord);
            case '.':
                return new FillableCell(coord);
            case '^':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '>':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '<':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case 'v':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
                }
                break;
        }

        return null;
    }
}

```
```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

/**
 * Represents a direction in reference to a {@link game.map.cells.Cell}.
 */
public enum Direction {
    UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT;

    /**
     * @return The opposite direction of {@code this}.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Direction getOpposite() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return DOWN;
            case DOWN:
                return UP;
            case LEFT:
                return RIGHT;
            case RIGHT:
                return LEFT;
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }

    /**
     * @return A unit coordinate offset as expressed by {@code this} coordinate.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Coordinate getOffset() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return new Coordinate(-1, 0);
            case DOWN:
                return new Coordinate(1, 0);
            case LEFT:
                return new Coordinate(0, -1);
            case RIGHT:
                return new Coordinate(0, 1);
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }
}

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

    @NotNull
    public final Coordinate coord;

    Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
        this.coord = coord;
    }

    /**
     * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
     *
     * <p>
     * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
     * W: Wall
     * .: Cell
     * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
     * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
     * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
     * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
     * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
     * </p>
     *
     * @param c Character to parse.
     * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
     * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
     *                        can be null.
     * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
     */
    public static @Nullable Cell fromChar(char c, @NotNull Coordinate coord, @Nullable TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
        switch (c) {
            case 'W':
                return new Wall(coord);
            case '.':
                return new FillableCell(coord);
            case '^':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '>':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '<':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case 'v':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
                }
                break;
        }

        return null;
    }
}

```

package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

/**
 * Represents a direction in reference to a {@link game.map.cells.Cell}.
 */
public enum Direction {
    UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT;

    /**
     * @return The opposite direction of {@code this}.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Direction getOpposite() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return DOWN;
            case DOWN:
                return UP;
            case LEFT:
                return RIGHT;
            case RIGHT:
                return LEFT;
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }

    /**
     * @return A unit coordinate offset as expressed by {@code this} coordinate.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Coordinate getOffset() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return new Coordinate(-1, 0);
            case DOWN:
                return new Coordinate(1, 0);
            case LEFT:
                return new Coordinate(0, -1);
            case RIGHT:
                return new Coordinate(0, 1);
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }
}

Response Text:---
```java
package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_RIGHT;
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SINK_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SINK_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SINK_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}
```

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_RIGHT;
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SINK_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SINK_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SINK_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_RIGHT;
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SINK_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SINK_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SINK_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

    @NotNull
    public final Coordinate coord;

    Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
        this.coord = coord;
    }

    /**
     * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
     *
     * <p>
     * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
     * W: Wall
     * .: Cell
     * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
     * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
     * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
     * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
     * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
     * </p>
     *
     * @param c Character to parse.
     * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
     * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
     *                        can be null.
     * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
     */
    public static @Nullable Cell fromChar(char c, @NotNull Coordinate coord, @Nullable TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
        switch (c) {
            case 'W':
                return new Wall(coord);
            case '.':
                return new FillableCell(coord);
            case '^':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '>':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '<':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case 'v':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
                }
                break;
        }

        return null;
    }
}

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

/**
 * Represents a direction in reference to a {@link game.map.cells.Cell}.
 */
public enum Direction {
    UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT;

    /**
     * @return The opposite direction of {@code this}.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Direction getOpposite() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return DOWN;
            case DOWN:
                return UP;
            case LEFT:
                return RIGHT;
            case RIGHT:
                return LEFT;
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }

    /**
     * @return A unit coordinate offset as expressed by {@code this} coordinate.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Coordinate getOffset() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return new Coordinate(-1, 0);
            case DOWN:
                return new Coordinate(1, 0);
            case LEFT:
                return new Coordinate(0, -1);
            case RIGHT:
                return new Coordinate(0, 1);
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }
}

```
- BOT: 
package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_RIGHT;
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SINK_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SINK_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SINK_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}

Response Text:---
The error indicates that the variables `SOURCE_UP`, `SOURCE_DOWN`, `SOURCE_LEFT`, `SOURCE_RIGHT`, `SINK_UP`, `SINK_DOWN`, `SINK_LEFT`, and `SINK_RIGHT` are not defined in the `PipePatterns` class. To fix this, we need to ensure that these variables are correctly defined as public static final char in the `PipePatterns` class. Since I don't have access to modify the `PipePatterns` class, I will assume that the `PipePatterns` class has methods to get the characters instead of public static final char variables.

```java
package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.getSourceUp();
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.getSourceDown();
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.getSourceLeft();
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.getSourceRight();
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.getSinkUp();
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.getSinkDown();
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.getSinkLeft();
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.getSinkRight();
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}

```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

```
```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

    @NotNull
    public final Coordinate coord;

    Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
        this.coord = coord;
    }

    /**
     * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
     *
     * <p>
     * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
     * W: Wall
     * .: Cell
     * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
     * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
     * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
     * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
     * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
     * </p>
     *
     * @param c Character to parse.
     * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
     * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
     *                        can be null.
     * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
     */
    public static @Nullable Cell fromChar(char c, @NotNull Coordinate coord, @Nullable TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
        switch (c) {
            case 'W':
                return new Wall(coord);
            case '.':
                return new FillableCell(coord);
            case '^':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '>':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '<':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case 'v':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
                }
                break;
        }

        return null;
    }
}

```
```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

/**
 * Represents a direction in reference to a {@link game.map.cells.Cell}.
 */
public enum Direction {
    UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT;

    /**
     * @return The opposite direction of {@code this}.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Direction getOpposite() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return DOWN;
            case DOWN:
                return UP;
            case LEFT:
                return RIGHT;
            case RIGHT:
                return LEFT;
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }

    /**
     * @return A unit coordinate offset as expressed by {@code this} coordinate.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Coordinate getOffset() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return new Coordinate(-1, 0);
            case DOWN:
                return new Coordinate(1, 0);
            case LEFT:
                return new Coordinate(0, -1);
            case RIGHT:
                return new Coordinate(0, 1);
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }
}

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.

	 * </p>

				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;

				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.getSourceUp();
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.getSourceDown();
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.getSourceLeft();
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.getSourceRight();
			};

				case UP -> PipePatterns.getSinkUp();
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.getSinkDown();
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.getSinkLeft();
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.getSinkRight();

	}

			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}

Response Text:---
The previous proposal had a compilation error because it was trying to call methods that do not exist in the `PipePatterns` class. The task is to fix the compilation error. I will assume that the `PipePatterns` class has static fields that represent the characters for each direction and type.

```java
package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_RIGHT;
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SINK_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SINK_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SINK_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}
```

Consider the following used class/interface: 
```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;

import java.util.Objects;

/**
 * Representation of a coordinate in {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public class Coordinate {

    public final int row;
    public final int col;

    public Coordinate(int row, int col) {
        this.row = row;
        this.col = col;
    }

    /**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    @Override
    public boolean equals(@Nullable Object obj) {
        if (obj == null) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!(obj instanceof Coordinate)) {
            return false;
        }

        return equals((Coordinate) obj);
    }

    public boolean equals(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return this.row == other.row && this.col == other.col;
    }

    @Override
    public int hashCode() {
        return Objects.hash(row, col);
    }

    /**
     * Adds {@code this} coordinate with another coordinate.
     *
     * @param other Other coordinate to add from.
     * @return New coordinate as a result of the addition.
     */
    @NotNull public Coordinate add(@NotNull Coordinate other) {
        return new Coordinate(this.row + other.row, this.col + other.col);
    }
}

```
```java
package game.map.cells;

import game.MapElement;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import org.jetbrains.annotations.Nullable;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;

/**
 * Representation of a cell in the {@link game.map.Map}.
 */
public abstract class Cell implements MapElement {

    @NotNull
    public final Coordinate coord;

    Cell(@NotNull Coordinate coord) {
        this.coord = coord;
    }

    /**
     * Parses a {@link Cell} from a character.
     *
     * <p>
     * Here is the list of characters to their corresponding map element:
     * W: Wall
     * .: Cell
     * ^: Source/Sink pipe pointing upward
     * v: Source/Sink pipe pointing downward
     * <: Source/Sink pipe pointing leftward
     * >: Source/Sink pipe pointing rightward
     * If the character does not represent a {@link TerminationCell}, the {@code terminationType} parameter can be ignored.
     * </p>
     *
     * @param c Character to parse.
     * @param coord Coordinate of the newly created cell.
     * @param terminationType If the character is a termination cell, its type. Otherwise, this argument is ignored and
     *                        can be null.
     * @return A cell based on the given creation parameters, or null if the parameters cannot form a valid Cell.
     */
    public static @Nullable Cell fromChar(char c, @NotNull Coordinate coord, @Nullable TerminationCell.Type terminationType) {
        switch (c) {
            case 'W':
                return new Wall(coord);
            case '.':
                return new FillableCell(coord);
            case '^':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.UP, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '>':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.RIGHT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case '<':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.LEFT, terminationType);
                }
                break;
            case 'v':
                if (terminationType != null) {
                    return new TerminationCell(coord, Direction.DOWN, terminationType);
                }
                break;
        }

        return null;
    }
}

```
```java
package util;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;

/**
 * Represents a direction in reference to a {@link game.map.cells.Cell}.
 */
public enum Direction {
    UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT;

    /**
     * @return The opposite direction of {@code this}.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Direction getOpposite() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return DOWN;
            case DOWN:
                return UP;
            case LEFT:
                return RIGHT;
            case RIGHT:
                return LEFT;
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }

    /**
     * @return A unit coordinate offset as expressed by {@code this} coordinate.
     */
    @NotNull
    public Coordinate getOffset() {
        switch (this) {
            case UP:
                return new Coordinate(-1, 0);
            case DOWN:
                return new Coordinate(1, 0);
            case LEFT:
                return new Coordinate(0, -1);
            case RIGHT:
                return new Coordinate(0, 1);
            default:
                throw new IllegalStateException("Unknown direction");
        }
    }
}

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SOURCE_RIGHT;
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.SINK_UP;
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.SINK_DOWN;
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.SINK_LEFT;
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.SINK_RIGHT;
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.

	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {

			this.dir = dir;
		}

package game.map.cells;

import org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull;
import util.Coordinate;
import util.Direction;
import util.PipePatterns;

/**
 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.
 */
public class TerminationCell extends Cell {

	private boolean isFilled = false;
	@NotNull
	public final Direction pointingTo;
	@NotNull
	public final Type type;

	/**
	 *
	 * @param coord coordination of this cell
	 * @param direction direction of this termination
	 * @param type type of this termination
	 */
	public TerminationCell(Coordinate coord, Direction direction, Type type) {
		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
	}

	/**
	 * Sets this cell as filled.
	 */
	public void setFilled() {
		this.isFilled = true;
	}

	/**
	 * <p>
	 * Hint: use {@link util.PipePatterns}
	 * </p>
	 *
	 * @return the character representation of a termination cell in game
	 */
	@Override
	public char toSingleChar() {
		if (type == Type.SOURCE) {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.getSourceUp();
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.getSourceDown();
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.getSourceLeft();
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.getSourceRight();
			};
		} else {
			return switch (pointingTo) {
				case UP -> PipePatterns.getSinkUp();
				case DOWN -> PipePatterns.getSinkDown();
				case LEFT -> PipePatterns.getSinkLeft();
				case RIGHT -> PipePatterns.getSinkRight();
			};
		}
	}

	public enum Type {
		SOURCE, SINK
	}

	/**
	 * Data class encapsulating the coordinate and direction of the {@link TerminationCell}.
	 */
	public static class CreateInfo {

		public final Coordinate coord;
		public final Direction dir;

		public CreateInfo(@NotNull Coordinate coord, @NotNull Direction dir) {
			this.coord = coord;
			this.dir = dir;
		}
	}
}

 * Represents a source or a sink {@link Cell}.

		super(coord);
		this.pointingTo = direction;
		this.type = type;
